newsArray.title: Ishan Kishan, out of Indian team, answers critics with statement century
creator: TOI Sports Desk
newsArray.description: Ishan Kishan's unbeaten 125 anchored Jharkhand's recovery to 307/6 against Tamil Nadu on day one of the Ranji Trophy. Defending champions Vidarbha reached 302/3 against Nagaland, with Aman Mokhade scoring 148. Andhra also enjoyed a strong start, ending day one at 300/2 against Uttar Pradesh, thanks to KS Bharat's 144.

newsArray.title: Ranji Trophy 2025: Ruturaj Gaikwad sparkles, Prithvi Shaw watches as Maharashtra recover from 18 for 5
creator: Sandip G
newsArray.description: Maharashtra were wobbling after Shaw’s duck but Gaikwad starred with a superb 91 to lead them to 179 for 7 against Kerala on a tricky pitch.

newsArray.title: Ranji Trophy: देवदत्त पडिक्कल, करुण नायर शतक से चूके, 20 महीने से बाहर टीम इंडिया के खिलाड़ी ने ठोक दी सेंचुरी
creator: TV9 Bharatvarsh
newsArray.description: रणजी ट्रॉफी की शुरुआत हो चुकी है. पहले दिन कई स्टार बल्लेबाजों ने अपनी बैटिंग का जलवा दिखाया. इस दौरान देवदत्त पडिक्कल और करुण नायर शतक बनाने से चूक गए. वहीं पिछले 20 महीनों से टीम इंडिया से बाहर चल रहे आंध्र प्रदेश के बल्लेबाज केएस भरत ने शानदार शतक ठोक दिया.

newsArray.description: ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi, who is also the Interior Minister of Pakistan, has re-iterated that if the Indian team wants the trophy, they must collect it from him.

newsArray.title: Women's World Cup: India fined 5 per cent match fee for slow over-rate against Australia
newsArray.description: Visakhapatnam (Andhra Pradesh) [India], October 15 (ANI): The Indian women's cricket team has been fined five per cent of their match fees for maintaining a slow over-rate during their match against Australia in the 13th fixture of the ongoing ICC Women's Cricket World Cup at the ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam.The sanctions were imposed by Michell Periera of the Emirates ICC International Panel of Mat

newsArray.title: ICC ODI Rankings: Afghanistan's Rashid and Omarzai Soar to Top after Bangladesh Series Sweep
creator: Asianet Newsable English
newsArray.description: After a 3-0 ODI sweep of Bangladesh, Afghanistan’s Rashid Khan and Azmatullah Omarzai top the ICC rankings for bowlers and all-rounders. Ibrahim Zadran rose to second in batting, while India gained in Test rankings after beating the West Indies.
